intro: Seseli montanum var. polyphyllum, commonly known as the mountain seseli, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. This variant is distinguished by its multiple leaflets and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats.
